meanings.definition: A person who corrects or makes something right.
meanings.sent1: The righters in the classroom always help fix mistakes.
meanings.sent2: The righters in the community work hard to improve things.
meanings.sent3: The righters at the party made sure everyone was having fun.
meanings.sent4: She was like a superhero, swooping in as the righter of wrongs.
meanings.sent5: The righters shone brightly, like beacons of justice.

meanings.definition: Those who advocate for or support a particular cause or belief.
meanings.sent1: The righters of animal rights fight for the well-being of animals.
meanings.sent2: Environmental righters work to protect the planet.
meanings.sent3: The righters of good manners always set a positive example.
meanings.sent4: She stood out as a righter of equality in a world of division.
meanings.sent5: The righters stood tall, united in their cause.

meanings.definition: The act of making something right or correcting a wrong.
meanings.sent1: The righters of the past fixed many societal injustices.
meanings.sent2: Legal righters ensure justice is served in the court.
meanings.sent3: The righters of the recipe added the missing ingredient.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a soothing balm, a righter of misunderstandings.
meanings.sent5: The righters' actions spoke louder than words, bringing harmony.
